newsitem.title: sri lanka: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - April 30.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - April 30.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sri Lankan press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Supreme Court ends hearing into case against government's proposed Broadcasting Authority bill. Decision to be conveyed to parliament Speaker.
Seven people hurt in clash between rival groups of undergraduates at Kelaniya University. Campus declared out of bounds for students.
Tamil Tiger rebel leaders summon reinforcements to their Mullaithivu stronghold fearing offensive by security forces.
Ten rallies and five processions to be held in Colombo by political parties and labour unions on May Day.
Finger pointed at leftwing Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (People's Liberation Front) in violence at Kelaniya University.
Nurses threaten 48-hour strike to back demands for pay hike.

Former minister of housing and local government and opposition United National Party strongman, Sirisena Cooray, returns to island. Cooray faces international arrest warrant for questioning by Special Presidential Commission probing assassination of former national security minister Lalith Athulathmudali.
